website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for an affordable remote that's easy to use, chances are it will impress you. However, it may not support all of your electronics.
pros: Remote is easy to set up, and the keypad is easy to navigate
cons: Although it is compatible with other devices such as DVRs and DVD players, it won't work with all brands
Some longevity concerns have been reported

customer_reviews.title: Commonly used “Back Button” solution
customer_reviews.text: BACK BUTTON has flaws. It will return to a previous app instead of going back to the “movie” section while on Netflix for example. It’s NOT that button! It’s the button directly left to the “ok” button.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a family member who had lost the remote to his TV and needed a new one. This was an old HD Haier TV, very very hard to find a replacement. And the replacement would've been more expensive. After trying all the Haier codes (none of which worked), I attempted to do the "Automatic code finding method", which found the code for the TV. So if none of the codes provided work for your TV, don't give up! Try the automatic code finding method in the manual. I love the sleek design and small form factor. It feels nice in the hand. Definitely recommend and will buy more if I need spare remotes in the future!
customer_reviews.author: J A

customer_reviews.title: If you have a Samsung, buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: We lost the remote for our Samsung TV and it got pretty old having to get up and turn it on or turn down the volume (it's 2017!). I ordered this not ever having used or set up a universal remote and once I popped the batteries in it just started working! Thank baby jesus! I didn't have to do any of the programming stuff since it is pre-set for Samsung TV's. Hallalejuah. I was worried, but couldn't make it easier than that. If you have a Samsung TV, get this! The price is right and it's pre-programmed.
customer_reviews.author: SliceAimmons

customer_reviews.title: Works Better Than Expected!
customer_reviews.text: My dog ate my DVD remote, so I was looking for something economical to replace it. This remote is fantastic! I managed to not only link my DVD player, but also my TV and XBOX! I was skeptical the TV was going to work because mine has SMART functions, but they all work. Can use it to pull up Netflix, Hulu, Prime TV, etc.
customer_reviews.author: William Holt

customer_reviews.title: Happy to report that it works perfectly with our ten ...
customer_reviews.text: After dragging my heels and dealing with several remotes (that barely worked) I finally broke down and purchased this for under $10. Happy to report that it works perfectly with our ten year-old AV setup AND our Roku. The master volume setting is a big bonus in my book. Outstanding value.
customer_reviews.author: CMY

customer_reviews.title: Preprogrammed for Samsung TV’s
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize when I purchased this that it was preprogrammed for Samsung TV’s, so when I got it and went to set it up I found this out and was pleasantly surprised that I didn’t have to do anything but put batteries in it. Great product and extremely easy to use, especially if you have a Samsung TV.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew J. Benson

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this remote for a television I got from someone FB Marketplace. The TV works great, but it didn’t come with a remote. This “Universal” remote is not so universal after all. It looks sleek, but only controls volume and channels, and I have had to reprogram it multiple times, basically every time I turn the TV off. Luckily, I have only had it about a week, so I definitely plan to return it. I got it as an add-on, but it’s not even worth the $5+ I paid. I will go to an electronics store next time.
customer_reviews.author: Mz. Kindra

customer_reviews.title: Not as Samsung “friendly” as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: As of right now I’m giving it one star because even though it claims to be preprogrammed and Samsung tv friendly, it’s appears it really isn’t. I am trying to connect it to a 19 inch Samsung led tv (UN19D4003 in case you’re wondering the mode type) and so far nothing is working. I’ve tried manually entering the codes provided and even went online and found a long list and none worked. I tried the auto code search and that also didn’t work. So if I can’t figure things out soon I’ll be returning the remote and ordering something else.
customer_reviews.author: dapple_apple

customer_reviews.title: Simple Tools Make the Best Impact!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic remote! I recently got the Apple TV 4K and have a Samsung TV. The Siri remote sucked with the touch pad gestures incredibly hard (and I have older people at home who are not wired for geeky remotes) to use. I got the Logitech Harmony 650 for $40 but I couldn't control volume on it on TV while controlling the Apple device and the remote was working on and off at random moments. This one is < $10 and was a breeze to setup with both my TV and Apple 4K and it almost replaces the Siri remote (only tiny thing is, the mic feature of Siri remote is not available; but I can live without that)
customer_reviews.author: V2Sri

customer_reviews.title: XBOX one code! Great remote!
customer_reviews.text: Got this remote like new from warehouse deals, and I am VERY pleased. The one question I didn't see answered here is the XBOX code. I have an XBOX One S and 2824 worked for me. If it doesn't for you, try 2134 or 2144 (both codes under Microsoft/XBOX on the provided code list didn't work because they're probably for the 360 or Xbox One non-S/X. Hopefully this helps someone out there. I googled it and found the answer in about 10 seconds. -:PROS:- - took about 5 minutes to program - Master volume setting - sleek brushed design - made 3 of my remotes obsolete -:CONS:- - have to relearn some buttons, but all features are still accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Mike5Coat

customer_reviews.title: Nice design
customer_reviews.text: Very pretty for a remote and works perfectly with my Sharp TV.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Smith

customer_reviews.title: Microscopic buttons, lost settings, sub-par performance
customer_reviews.text: Our remote controls went missing when we moved--Samsung TV and sound bar, DVD, and a ROKU streaming device. OK, so this covers all the bases...except it doesn't. The buttons are tiny which means the symbols/text on them is microscopic--but that's just an irritant. It consistently lost stored codes, and the only code for the sound bar did not provide any functionality beyond volume control. Scan is a joke--it's ten codes at a time, with the code tapped out by flashing red light when you stumble into it. If it kept codes, we could live with it, but I wound up reprogramming it nightly or more.
customer_reviews.author: Gary McCaleb

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set Up and Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I promptly found my remote that I had lost in a move the month before upon receiving this remote. I decided to keep it anyway as an extra. I actually prefer it to the original remote. It is sleek, thin, and the appearance is non offensive. The remote came with instructions that were easy to follow for programming and it was ready to use within five minutes (including me searching for batteries... you never know if the ones in the junk drawer are new or not). I would definitely recommend this remote to anyone needing to replace their original. It’s a great device at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: It works with my devices.
customer_reviews.text: This remote works with all of my devices except my Roku, and that's wonderful. It's thin and works very well. The only downside to my understanding is that it only holds your codes for your devices for 10 minutes if the batteries die completely, but keep some batteries around, and don't worry about missing remotes or having to juggle up to four of them instead of this great product.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Even the remote matches her theme.
customer_reviews.text: Adding to my wife's Grey and Pink bedroom theme, this remote has come into the picture. We had some problems with the old remote and battery consumption. For some reason it would eat a pair of batteries in a few weeks. Enter this remote. It's the same compact size as the original but thinner. My wife loves the color since it matches her theme. Happy wife, happy life!
customer_reviews.author: B.T.S.Top Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: A great, basic
customer_reviews.text: A great, basic, no frills remote control. It will control your TV, DVD, VCR, BluRay, and anything else that uses IR. I even set it up to control my sound bar, and evidently it will work with Roku as well. It’s very lightweight and slim.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Better than my first impression led me to believe.
customer_reviews.text: My original review knocked this remote because I could not get it connected to my Roku. However, after ordering a replacement, setting it up, and discovering it was very particular on the remote being pointed very directly at the Roku, I decided to give this one another shot in connecting. To my delight it works great! I am giving it five stars, however when I originally had difficulties I emailed Jasco for help and received no response. The remote is great, customer service is lacking. I am so very happy it turned out an error on my part was the only reason this was not working for me originally, because the replacement remote was an issue too.
customer_reviews.author: Irish I Was TanTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Works when it wants to
customer_reviews.text: Every day I have to take the battery cover off and put it back on for it to work for some reason. Tried multiple batteries and still the same issue. Not the end of the world for a $9 remote but the big issue is about once a week it decides to forget its programming. Its gotten to the point where I know from memory the code for my TV. You get what you pay for here.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Hey guys, this product is well worth buying.  Try to catch it at the $5.84 value as an "Add on" item.
customer_reviews.text: Hey guys, this product is well worth buying. Try to catch it at the $5.84 price as an "Add on" item. The material is really nice. Has a solid, heavy, quality feel to it. The only thing that I first thought it didn't have was an "Info" button to tell me what show was on each channel, but I found it... It's the button that just has an asterisk "*". Not sure why they labeled it that way, but now that I know where it is, this remote is pretty awesome.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what you think it will very well!
customer_reviews.text: In the basement we had a Vizio TV remote that was dying, an LG sound bar remote that was always going missing, and a Samsung DVD that didn't have a remote, plus the Roku remote. Programming the GE universal remote was so simple and in 5 minutes my remote headaches were solved. As I have a Roku Stick the Roku remote is a Bluetooth remote, not an IR one, so you can't program the GE remote for it, but that's not a fault of the remote. Great quality, great price, would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor G

customer_reviews.title: I bought 6!
customer_reviews.text: My dog Rocket ate the first two I purchased (which were replacements for the original remotes that I Iost). The remotes must be a tasty beef flavor since that is what Rocket prefers. Prior to their consumption, the remote is easy to program, accesses all features on my devices, has good range and has an amazing crunch and great flavor your dog craves! Both remotes endured multiple chewings before they ultimately died which shows they are pretty durable because a 95lb Pyrenees makes short work of most things plastic. Lastly since it's priced so low, I can afford to replace them. Best all-around value you can find!
customer_reviews.author: Colin - dEAD HANDS WOODwORKING

customer_reviews.title: Missing next/previous chapter buttons, otherwise good remote
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's good, but some real downsides. It's thin and light and easy to hold, and it was easy to pair it with my tv and Blu-ray player. But...it doesn't have a next chapter button (only a fast forward button) which is a huge disappointment. (It also doesn't have a subtitles button, which I probably use more often than other people, so it matters to me but it may not matter to you.) So I'll keep it, and be using it regularly, but it's too bad cause it's close to perfect otherwise. I'd probably return it if I had lost the other remotes and this was meant to be the be-all-end-all, but since it's just for convenience, I'll keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Tawn

customer_reviews.title: Could never get it to work with my Apple TV
customer_reviews.text: I'm an Apple fan, but the remote to the newest Apple TV is very difficult to use and I hate it. bought this to substitute (would rather have buttons and arrows than the inoperable track pad thing on the Apple remote). Could not get it to work (I've had a Harmony before and understand how to enter the codes). This was just too much trouble. Seemed well made for other applications, but not for Apple TV/
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Wu

customer_reviews.title: Great Remote *Update* maybe not so great.
customer_reviews.text: *Update* After 3 days, the only mode that will work is TV. It is being replaced for free and i will update this review again if my replacement works like I hoped the first one would. This remote quickly paired with my TV, Sound bar, and my Roku. It was super easy to pair with my devices and I liked that the remote was much smaller than I imagined. It is only slightly larger than my Roku remote and it is very thing. Very pleased with this remote!
customer_reviews.author: Kneedeep971

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Roku players
customer_reviews.text: I was able to easily program the remote for my TV (Vizio). Unfortunately the reason I purchased this remote was because it was supposed to be compatible with Roku. (Not the stick the normal box) It is not. There is one Roku code which does not work. I researched online to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Jeni Bean

customer_reviews.title: It works with everything, including our Roku!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried other universal remotes in the past and never had complete success with them so we always had one or two devices that the universal device would not work with so we still had multiple controllers. This controller is nice looking, it easily hooked up to my Magnavox TV and my Samsung sound bar and our LG DVD player and with Roku which was a surprise to me. It was easy enough to follow the directions to hook up the remote control with all of the devices. It’s a little on the slim side so it’s kind of hard to hold onto but that is very minor detail. The price was amazing!
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Works on Apple TV 4th gen and Roku 3 beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully on Apple TV 4th gen and Roku 3. Setup was simple. Used the provided code from the list that came with the remote. I have been using it for a few days now. Highly recommend, especially if you don't like the Apple TV remote. I got it to replace the Apple TV remote but great that I can use the same for Roku and TV as well. Codes used: ATV 4th gen: 1093 Roku 3: 2014 PS: Functions that don't work on ATV with this remote - Voice command, Siri (expected) - Double tap home button to switch between open apps Rating: 4.5/5
customer_reviews.author: R. Kamath

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: Its fine as a basic multi-remote but will not properly control my Denon AVR regardless of codes. Not any better than my 11 year old Philips universal remote which has more functions. Ideal for the bedroom however where it replaces clunky samsung TV and bluray remotes. 67 year old retired blue collar factory worker and I'm finding the rose color is a very subtle, pleasant shade that doesnt look pink or feminine at all. Looks more like copper to me. And of course the wife likes it too.
customer_reviews.author: Dweib McGeeTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: $10 incredibly well spent
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with this remote...feels like good quality and has a bit of weight to it...at least as far as generic remotes go. The brushed look surface is nice and the grey provides a good contrast from the buttons. Setup was easier than I expected. A couple buttons, a pin, and good to go. The device pin list is MASSIVE and covers even some of the smallest knock-off brands. This is flawless with a Changhong TV
customer_reviews.author: Luke F

customer_reviews.title: Works for all my devices
customer_reviews.text: In the master bedroom it controls small wireless remote Direct TV satellite receiver, TCL/Roku smart TV, all functions. completely replaces both remotes. Tried in living room and it controls Roku Stick, Samsung TV, and large Direct TV base station as well. Replaces three remotes. No doubt it would control a DVD/blue ray player as well, but don't have one of those anymore. Wonderful not having to mess with more than one remote anymore. I tried several and this is the first one that did them all flawlessly. Now that I know it works for everything, I'll buy a few more and get the lighted ones. So inexpensive they can be on the nightstands on both sides of the bed.
customer_reviews.author: South Texan

customer_reviews.title: It didnt work...and then it did
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this on my vizio Tv...and tried everything...manually entered every code...several times...did the auto code load...and that didnt work either....then I tried to get it to work on a Dynex Tv...I did the auto code load...and it worked...I could turn the TV off and on ...but all functions were not accessible...so I then tried to load the codes manually...and the one code gave me features that I needed...I needed to use the input button...so I could switch between antenna/air setting...and HDMI...so I could stream...the first code on the list for Dynex did the trick...it took about half an hour to figure it out and set it up...but I did get it to work properly
customer_reviews.author: svenlovesflo

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Great Value, Works for Sansui
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this GE universal remote for an ancient Sansui TV we received for free. I was afraid that it wouldn’t work being that I’ve never even heard of a Sansui TV before. However, my husband tried the codes on the manual and found that, towards the end, one of the codes works (of course he didn’t remember the code). Lol The remote appears to be of great quality, and it works. The buttons are responsive and do not get stuck. It’s a very thin sleek design. It measures 7” in length, about 1.75” in width. Very lightweight and easy on the hands. It does require two AAA batteries which are not included.
customer_reviews.author: Kailey

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Easy Setup!
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a remote that successfully set up the first try. I have an Orion TV (never heard of that brand until my husband brought it home) and I didn't have a lot of confidence that an inexpensive remote would work, but this one worked on my first try. All I had to do was to enter a four-digit code that came with the instructions and boom, that was it. It's worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Inquiring Mind

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for me! I had trouble finding a universal remote that would work with my old Kenwood receiver but this one works great! I tried remotes that cost twice as much as this one but they would not work with my Kenwood receiver. All I normally use it for is to turn on my Panasonic plasma tv and my Kenwood receiver for watching TV or Netflix. But I can also control my Samsung blue ray player with this unit. No issues at all. I also love how light weight the remote is. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar Dan

customer_reviews.title: Setup & used in less than 1 Minute on Panasonic/FireStick
customer_reviews.text: Setting this remote up was super easy! I had it setup and working in about 30 seconds on 2 different Panasonic TV models: TH-58PZ700U and TC-P65S1. Both of them worked with the first Panasonic TV code in the instructions: 5821. I was instantly able to power on/off, change changes, scroll through channels, adjust volume, change input sources, recall previous channels, etc. As a bonus, this remote also directly controls the Amazon Fire Stick without any additional setup so that worked immediately as well. The remote itself is small to medium sized (bigger than a streaming device remote like a Fire Stick but bigger than normal TV remotes I am accustomed to), very light, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Edward O

customer_reviews.title: Buttons do not function properly
customer_reviews.text: So the remote works I programmed it to my tv, but done of the buttons do what they are supposed to do. The channel up and down button doesn’t work. The volume up doesn’t work, but the volume down button actually turns the volume down. The back button turns the volume up. The input button works and the numbers work. Crazy. I will keep because I just need it to turn the tv on and off and volume.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Good 4 Device Universal Remote
customer_reviews.text: I use it to control a Toshiba TV, Roku, Panasonic Blu Ray Player, and Comcast X1 box. It works as expected and was easy to program using the codes provided. I have seen a couple of review specifically say it did not support their Comcast X1 box. I have an Arris model X1 and this remote does support my X1 box. The code that worked for my X1 box was 1554. You don't get voice control functionality but all the basic functionality is there.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Rowley

customer_reviews.title: Really? No back button?
customer_reviews.text: I was really psyched with how well this works and how easy it was to set up. But then I tried to back out of a video on my TV's YouTube app - turns out the "back" button is actually an "exit" button. There doesn't seem to be a way to go back a screen without backing out of the entire app. For a remote that claims to be optimized for Samsung TVs, that's a pretty big oversight. (It really does work fantastically besides that, though.)
customer_reviews.author: AVC

customer_reviews.title: Best $10 I have ever spent!
customer_reviews.text: After our new puppy chewed up our DirecTV remote for the third time we were embarrassed to call DirecTV for yet another replacement. She had already eaten the remote for the sound bar and we were getting up every time we wanted to change the volume so I decided to give this a try. Setup was a breeze- took all of ten minutes. Full function control for our Sharp TV, DirecTV box, Sony Bluray player and Vizio sound bar. If you have more than 4 devices you will need a different remote but if you don't, this remote can't be beat for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Solomito

customer_reviews.title: Nice little remote.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good looking control, and seems to support an enormous variety of home entertainment equipment. Looks like it does best as a replacement for recent models (TV, DVD, SoundBars, streaming devices, etc). Unfortunately, it does not fully support my JVC Micro Stereo System (FS-Y1). The only features it could drive were the power and volume - but none of the disc, radio or setup features. This isn't surprising because my system is well over 10yrs old. Still, I hoped to get lucky. No dice. This is something I'd happily buy again should the need arise.
customer_reviews.author: B Parker

customer_reviews.title: Good but not for me
customer_reviews.text: I searched the reviews before I ordered and one review said this remote control would work with an Optoma projector. I also saw the Optoma code in the PDF so I was hopeful... but turned out this remote did NOT work with my Optoma HD143x nor the FireTV (which I didn't even think about since it was such a simple remote control to mimic). Anyway, this remote control was able to control my Sony Bluray player and my Sony sound bar so I was able to replace 2 remote controls with 1 which still left me with 3 remote controls instead of 4.
customer_reviews.author: Master Shifu

customer_reviews.title: Great universal remote — test all buttons when programming
customer_reviews.text: I continue to lose remotes, as I use Apple TVs but do live standard remotes for sleep timers. I use this on one LG TV and on one Samsung TV, and it works great on both. Originally, the down and side arrows didn’t work as expected post-programming, but I then realized that it was a function of an incorrect code having been used. Therefore, even if the power and some other buttons work after programming, it’s worth noting that some non-functioning buttons could indicate that an incorrect code was used, in which case a simple “re-program until all buttons work” should do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I lost my living room remote a few months ago and I finally got a new one. This is the same as the one I have in my bedroom and it works great!. It is easy to program and comes with instructions and codes to connect the remote to your tv regardless of the brand. I would buy it again if needed. I recommend to anyone looking.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Works, but doesn't feel like a quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Device works great with my 2013 Samsung Smart TV. My only complaint would be the feeling in the hand. The device has buttons mushier than mashed potatoes and doesn't have much if any weight to it. It works, but definitely doesn't feel quality, then again for the price I really can't fault it too harshly. I read reviews saying the back buttons don't work for smart apps, but it may be due to software incompatibilities with newer TV's or people not realizing pressing left on the arrows isn't a back key (what I've gathered after reading reviews) back key is located below left arrow button that is located next to "ok".
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K

customer_reviews.title: does not work for my application.
customer_reviews.text: Does not function with prprovided code 0725 for my insignia is-hc040918 stereo receiver. Unable to find any other codes online. Also not working with my denon CD changer.
customer_reviews.author: Josh S.

customer_reviews.title: Remote Exceeded My Expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure if this remote would be easily programmable for a Sanyo Blueray player I had since lost the remote for, rendering the blueray player useless. The packaging for this remote stated that the device opened blueray players and I was initially dissappointed but went through the setup of the device anyway. I was pleased how easy the setup instructions were and that it did more than open the tray on my blueray player. It is a fully functional Blueray remote for my Sanyo player. Additionally, I programmed operation of my TV, Cable Box, and Roku from this device. This inexpensive remote has exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: ajgood

customer_reviews.title: Apple TV remote Alternative
customer_reviews.text: Excellent remote for those who hate the Apple TV remote. I use this with my Vizio tv, Bose speakers, and Apple TV. I wanted something, anything, to use so that I would not have to use that Apple TV remote. This works great. I can have the remote set to work with the Apple TV and the volume button still operates my Bose speakers, which is nice because I don’t have to switch between two devices on the remote (i.e., you can designate a device to control volume even when the rest of the remote is controlling the tv or Apple device). Excellent price and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: DinoJr

customer_reviews.title: great remote at a great price, easy to program
customer_reviews.text: just as the title says. This is our second one on account of we can't find the other one. Got the rose gold, it's more coppery, but it's alright. Easy to program. Works with Tv, , Roku, soundbars, DVD/bluray etc. It does have an auto search feature but luckily it's easy to set up and each of the 4 digit codes i tried worked the forst time for our tv and roku. I like how you can also set ip up to have a master volume, like if you're controlling the roku, it'll still do TV volume without having to select TV again. Would by again.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent. Missing “exit” button
customer_reviews.text: Not too shabby for $10! I programmed my 10 year old LG, my gagillion year old Denon and my Directv to the remote. Directv seems to be the only one effected by the lack of an “exit” button. When you’re in a menu, it’d be nice to hit a button for an easy cancel option but you’re only able to back out of steps, 1 by 1. Which works, but is annoying. Random buttons power random options for Directv. Like the “home” button powers the guide, the “.” button powers On Demand. Small things like that take adjusting but they work so I’m happy!
customer_reviews.author: aznenvazen

customer_reviews.title: It really is the little things.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, this might really be the best 10 bucks I've spent all year. It makes no sense to trouble with two remotes for a 43" tv and a mini soundbar, so when I broke the remote that came with my TCL tv, this came up. Works like a charm. The single TCL/Roku code worked perfectly on a 43s425. There were several Sony soundbar codes; the first few either didn't work or did volume changes only, I think the 5th or 6th code gave full control of the connected ht-s200f. It's simply silly that a $10 3rd party accessory would be the holy grail of any setup, but hey- it works.
customer_reviews.author: Dave The Wet Sprocket

customer_reviews.title: Controls my TCL TV, Xbox One, and Sound Bar flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: I have a TCL 4K TV, a Samsung sound bar, and an Xbox One that are all now controlled by this one remote. I couldn't be happier. Great product for a great price. I also like the fact that I can set the volume to always change the volume on the sound bar, not whatever device it is set to at the moment. Makes turning the sound down much less of a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: AJFischer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work with Apple TV
customer_reviews.text: I specifically purchased this to replace my Apple TV remote because those things are so damn small. It says it is compatible but it isn't with my Apple TV. I tried the remote's directions, and Apple's directions to pair it, and Apple TV says "No signal". Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Peri Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, this remote did not work for me. I don’t have an old Sharp, but it isn’t brand new, and maybe that’s why, but I tried to program it three times from the list of codes and auto program twice, though I had no idea when to stop trying. I sat there for an hour. Nothing. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I got this remote for a Sharp Blu-Ray Player and it works great. Almost all of the buttons do exactly what I want them to do. The only thing that didn't work when I programmed it the first time was the volume, but since I have a remote that works for the TV volume, that wasn't a big deal; plus, there are additional easy-to-follow instructions to help if something like the volume doesn't work if I had wanted to program it more. Aesthetically, it also looks very sleek and nice - exactly like the picture says it'll look.
customer_reviews.author: JayCski

customer_reviews.title: Good remote for the price, but ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good remote for a simple set up, like TV, receiver, sound bar. Set up was simple and worked right out of the box for my Samsung TV. However, if you have an item like a DVD player it is much more trouble than it's worth. The TV and sound bar require different inputs for the extra device and this requires a more expensive, complex remote to make it work. Otherwise you're have to push too many buttons and have to figure out what some of the buttons do which is not covered in the very brief instructions.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use with JVC TV DVD combo
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours trying to set this remote up on JVC TV/DVD combo. I found out accidentally my Samsung remote controlled the tv functions. None of the JVC codes worked so I tried the Samsung codes. The Samsung codes worked great. As far as the DVD function,I had very little success. Using the search function was painfully tedious and unfruitful. I found eventually using the Samsung code in the DVD function I can use the input button to skip ahead scenes but still have no control over the stop, pause, rewind etc functions. There is an 800# for support, will try calling them tomorrow as they are closed on Sundays. My TV is model LT-24DE74.
customer_reviews.author: MikeD

customer_reviews.title: Never buy another Apple TV remote again!
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have went through several broken/cracked Apple TV remotes and spent a pretty penny for a OEM replacement. Never again, just happen to see this while searching for ANOTHER Apple TV remote and glad I listened to the reviews and gave it a chance. Super quick and easy setup for my Vizio TV and soundbar, Apple TV and my Toshiba blue ray player. Put all those OEM remotes in the drawer with my cracker Apple TV remotes and didn’t look back. Love it and can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. F. Perez

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on Vizio.
customer_reviews.text: None of the Vizio codes work for my Vizio. I used the scan function and found a code that at least works for the power and volume buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for TCL 5 Series remote
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I have a TCL 5 Series Roku TV. The one that came with it was garbage and only worked if you were standing 2 feet front and center. The main functions I was looking for were tv, blu-ray player, and sound bar control (if I get one), volume button, back button, mute button, home button. Some reviewers suggested using the auto program which I tried first and only some of the buttons worked. When I manually entered the first code listed, all of the buttons functioned properly! It has great range and it looks nice, it's light weight and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Tenobb

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, choppy results, stopped working less than a year after I bought it
customer_reviews.text: It was very difficult to pair with the different devices, as the codes provided did not necessarily work and you had to try many options and combinations to actually get the control to work in each. In addition the functionality was extremely choppy (worked two days and other two would not). It would de-program every few months and just go crazy (and there would be the need to re-start the process of finding the right codes, thankfully saved the pamphlet with them). Stopped working all together less than a year after I purchased it. No water damage, no battery problem. Just stopped working. Dead.
customer_reviews.author: Gh

customer_reviews.title: BEST REMOTE $-4-$
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase this time initially, as I wanted a touch screen or led screen remote. However, I ultimately just went with this simple version with the led backlight. I am so happy I purchased this item, it came pre-set for samsung smart TV. I opened the box and the power, input, and volume controls all worked flawlessly. I purchased this to replace my standard samsung remote and I am very happy with the purchase. Works great, price great, consumer greatly happy.
customer_reviews.author: JoeSacramento

customer_reviews.title: It's 1994 all over again!
customer_reviews.text: Very old-school approach to the world of unified remotes, but it works reliably and with a minimum of fuss. The code list seems very complete, and it handles moderately complicated systems, such as a TV, setup box, and integrated amplifier stereo system. So if you want a remote that will just work without a lot of programming, updates, connecting to a computer, and all the other crap that comes along with more sophisticated universal remotes, you might just appreciate this product. On the other hand, if you want to have a conversation with it, run sophisticated macros, integrate it into your home control system, move on, nothing to see here, this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo

customer_reviews.title: Worked for Toshiba
customer_reviews.text: Picked up a used (2006) Toshiba LCD TV without a remote. It took all of 10 minutes to get this set up to control the TV. The control codes for Toshiba (and a bazillion other brands) are on the included information and the first code on the list was all it took! An added bonus was that code controlled both the older Toshiba and the newer 2013 Toshiba in the house! I haven't gotten to programing any other devices in the house yet, so I will revisit this review when I do that or if it fails.
customer_reviews.author: T. Richesin

customer_reviews.title: Works great, even on older devices!
customer_reviews.text: I'm only using it for my TV, surround sound system (which is quite old), and Blu-ray player. It was super easy to setup. For each device, the first code listed under the brand name worked. I love the master volume control which ensures the surround sound system is the one being adjusted regardless of what device the remote is currently set to control. I am so happy I paid the extra for backlit because it allows me to watch movies in a darkened room and still easily use the remote. It's lightweight and fits comfortably in my hand. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph C. Alderson

customer_reviews.title: replaced the BOSE soundbar remote
customer_reviews.text: The remote that came with my BOSE soundbar on my Samsung TV was aggravating because the return button does not work with the TV, BOSE support refuses to fix, and I found this remote recommended in a forum and ordered one to test, works perfectly, in Netflix and Hulu the return key works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L.

customer_reviews.title: love my pink remote
customer_reviews.text: Lost my original remote and ordered this as a replacement. I LOVE pink so this was perfect. I was able to connect it to my tv and cable box which is nice to have the one remote rather than two. Haven't had any issues with it. Love how slim and sleek it is as well. They ONLY downside is that I'm not able to go to "On Demand" to watch missed episodes from ABC...etc. But maybe I can find a way around it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Overall Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Let's all be real. You're looking at a $10 remote to replace your broken one, or to consolidate a massive pile that is all your devices before someone in your home murders someone else about where or why the TV doesn't work. For $10 you cannot do better than this. I was in the first category. My Insignia TV remote unexpectedly died. I didn't expect this to work or to be easy. It was a tiny bit daunting to go through the instructions and code list but it's not rocket science. You can do it, and for $10 you can be the short term hero of your home.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Stanforth

customer_reviews.title: Works with Roku and Amazon FireStick
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Purchased 3 different colors. It does not have a special button for Roku or Firestick but you can set it up on the AUX button or DVD button or any of the 4 buttons. I have the Vizio TV, Cable, Soundbar and either the Roku or Firestick, depending on which room it's in, all programmed onto the remote.
customer_reviews.author: BeachNY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for failing factory remote
customer_reviews.text: My Philips TV remote started having channel up/down button problems (took multiple hits for one--or more--to register). Bought this to use to preserve life left on the original, and I have not been disappointed (yet). Took two code tries to find the best match for my TV. It covers all the main features of the factory remote plus the special green/blue/red/yellow buttons needed for re-scanning the channels. Easy to see and read, good button placement. Don't know about longevity yet.
customer_reviews.author: Hephaestus01

customer_reviews.title: Great for Apple TV
customer_reviews.text: Even with my Apple TV mounted on the back of my TV, this still works perfectly. As much as I love the Apple TV, I absolutely hate the stupid touch remote. It's neato, but if you have a pet, their feet just somehow magically gravitate to that stupid touch pad and mess up your movie right in the middle. This is no-frills, nothing fancy, and just does one thing well. Easy enough to set up, if you've ever programmed a universal remote before. Took a couple minutes. Does everything I need it to just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Suddenly or remote stopped working even with new batteries. We had a few old directv remotes that we hoped we could program for this 13 year old Samsung. I must have gone through a hundred or more codes without success. Oh oh. Can I find a remote that will work with my tv? My TV is old and I really don't want to leave the couch to use it. Well this remote was the right price with good reviews. The hardest thing about the new remote was getting it out of the plastic. It seamlessly connected with the TV. No problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: sushicatlover

customer_reviews.title: Finally menu options on my Vizio again!!
customer_reviews.text: My Vizio remote was damaged quite a while ago and I was frustrated not being able to access the menu. Within a few minutes of opening the package I was able to program it to the correct code for turning the Vizio on and off and volume but the second code I tried did those plus open the menu. The directions tell you to verify on/off & volume but if all of your functions are not working try a different code. There are some that will do the basic functions & There may be some that do the basic functions Plus.
customer_reviews.author: Greg R.

customer_reviews.title: Easily Controls LG and Samsung TV'S and Roku Express
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these remotes to control an LG tv and a Samsung tv, both outfitted with Roku Express, after deciding to stream tv, rather than paying outrageous cable Bill's. I had no problem programming the remotes for each tv and roku, following the directions enclosed with the remotes. The remotes also control the input on each television, unlike the universal remote that they replaced from the cable company. Each remote has replaced 3 remote controls, and they take up very little room.
customer_reviews.author: dsk

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Between the reviews and the price I was looking forward to getting this remote. After googling the proper codes (dont bother with the 100 that they give you with the instructions. Much easier online), I programmed it quickly and thought I was ready to go. But for some reason the remote unprograms itself. I used the tv and cable just fine for a few days, but when I tried my Roku I had to reprogram it. So I got that working and then tried to adjust the volume on my tv...guess what wasnt programmed anymore? After reprogramming all my devices several times for a week I decided to return it and try another model.
customer_reviews.author: Cherice Silva

customer_reviews.title: Have it programmed for 2 tv's
customer_reviews.text: I set it up for a Hisesnse on tv button and a samsung on the cable button. both worked with code on list provided. Of course there a a couple of functions not available, but that is to be expected on a universal remote as each brand have buttons specific to a particular function. But it was easy to set up and the lighted buttons was what I was after. Wish the manufacturers would get onboard and provide lighted remotes with the set.
customer_reviews.author: Phils Deal

customer_reviews.title: True universal
customer_reviews.text: I got this remote because it's the only one that can accept 4 digit device codes as well as the modern 3 digit device codes. I have a 2008 Sony TV that has more features and wider compatibility than most TVs today but most universals just have the 3 digit compatibility. This remote not only turns on my Sony but can access all the features. And as remotes go this one is light, sturdy and durable. It's worth the $10. all year long.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor JAM

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my HDTV Hitachi with Roku
customer_reviews.text: I saw others posted this didn't work for their tv ( like mine), I bought it anyways to try. The recommended code for the Hitachi Roku didn't work, but the first code for Hitachi Tvs worked. So some of the other reviews may not have tried those codes. Exactly as I expected. My original remote died, don't know what went wrong. Just needed a volume control and to switch between HDMIs. I'll update if I ever use other bottons and they don't work.
customer_reviews.author: A.S.H

customer_reviews.title: LIFE SPAN: 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after four months of light use. Even without a "back" button, I purchased and managed fine without it. It simply stopped working. Changed the batteries, nothing. Tried to reprogram the remote, nothing. No response at all from the remote. Really bums me out b/c I do not like the Roku TV remote with the volume buttons on the side. However, it works so I will quite my petty crying about a side button volume control.
customer_reviews.author: Vee M

customer_reviews.title: awesome little gadget
customer_reviews.text: I got my DVD / VCR player second-hand at a thrift store with no remote. The first remote ($5) I ordered off of Amazon was pretty useless: it only allowed me to play, pause, ff and rew. This remote cost double my first purchase, but OMG -- it is running my tv, cable box, roku and dvd /vcr player. No more basket full of remotes at my elbow and fumbling for the right one. Super easy to program -- even for hardware illiterate me. Super-slim, almost like a cell phone. I'm going to need to get used to that.
customer_reviews.author: KSA

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This remote was super easy to connect and set up to our smart TV when we lost the original remote. I was worried that because it was a smart TV we wouldn't be able to access the Smart Hub where Netflix and all that it, but it still worked fine. I was also surprised to find how many devices you could connect it to, including a Roku. I didn't use that, but thought it was a neat feature. We ended up finding the old remote eventually, but still keep this one as a backup when our 2 year old hides it under the couch or someplace.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: DVD player I bought in Hong Kong, and this remote works !
customer_reviews.text: Pioneer DVD player I'd picked up at a Duty Free that plays all regions. And somehow lost the remote. Tried this replacement and of course didn't work right away as theirs is tailored for Panasonic. Went through all the Pioneer DVD codes in their list and none of them did anything. <grumble>. But then they have a neat alternative, process that tries out 10 codes at a time and lets you find the one that works. Like 5 minutes to find one for me ... woulda take 3 minutes if I'd only read all the instructions for how to do this. So I'm sold.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Darwin

customer_reviews.title: Works great, reminds me of 1980's instructions
customer_reviews.text: The remote is slim and well designed. Fits in hand well and TV response is similar to original remote. The instructions are brief and can be confusing, but somehow managed to get it to work. Almost had to pull up a YouTube video. Several codes to try to each brand and many kinds of devices, unfortunately, I have one device too obscure to be included.
customer_reviews.author: shopping_turtle

customer_reviews.title: Great universal remote for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We lost our remote. We have 5 kids. No one lost it. But it’s missing. This worked great for our Phillips tv and it hasn’t been lost or stolen by no one yet. I hope no one stays away because this was a great deal but I don’t want to buy a third remote. Easy to set up. Easy to use. Even easy to put Velcro on the back and on the side of the tv so the children if daring can put said remote where it belongs. If you need a new remote I recommend it. We’ve tried others but this one really is one of the best we’ve tried.
customer_reviews.author: Tamitch1979

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the aggrevation
customer_reviews.text: I got the TV to work but not the Cox mini-box or DVD player. Although the TV setup worked fine, for some reason the device would not "pulse" on automatic nor did any of the codes work for my mini-box or DVD player. Not worth returning because the packaging is destroyed when opening. Too much setup time being frustrated. I guess having 4 remotes is not that bad. One star because it did work for one device
customer_reviews.author: Richard S

customer_reviews.title: Advanced universal remote
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a universal remote, I thought Id go through the Hassel trying to program the remote to connect to the tv. But all I did was press the on/off button and that's all it took. It changed channels and put the volume up without me having to look for a code. I was so amazed. Never been so happy with a universal remote. It's lightweight and slim. The fact that you can connect not only one but more than one device is so cool. Unlike other universal remotes that are bulky and so hard to program and have one feature. Very happy!! Four stars only because I've had it for one day only.
customer_reviews.author: Ev

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously easy to pair with TV. Work flawlessly, super cheap
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these (lose remotes a lot) to use on my Visio 55” and 32” LED. I’m literally the least tech savvy person ever and prob wouldn’t remember how to use a toaster over tbh. But so easy to pair. Work flawlessly. And were super cheap! ($5 for silver at my time). Just find your TV brand on the list of codes and pop them into on the remote when tolerance . I about freaked when I saw Visio had like 10+ codes that could possibly be current depending on your model. Used very first code on list, worked for both my Visio 55” and 32”.
customer_reviews.author: Analytical VTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: No BACK Button !!!
customer_reviews.text: Any smart TV has a hierarchy of menu items. You often need to step back one step. Say you are watching a show, and need to return to the previous screen to pick another show. You CAN'T with this remote. There are 2 buttons labeled RETURN and Channel-Return -- both of them do something else. The RETURN button exits the current application COMPLETELY. The Channel-Return button does nothing. DO NOT BUY THIS REMOTE IF YOU HAVE A SMART TV.
customer_reviews.author: Srinivasa

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Love this remote. After the main one that came with the cable box got water damage I was desperate for another one. I didn’t wanna pay a lot and when I found this super affordable one I was a skeptic. I bought silver because black blends in with couch and it’s easier to find. This remote is a lifesaver. It’s honestly more convenient and easier to use than the original one I had. The setup instructions were super easy to follow. It’s not huge and bulky like the last remote as well. I can do regular remote functions as well as switch the tv over to other hdmi to use my computer on the screen! Recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Awesome Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I picked this remote out because I desperately needed a remote for an older TV that uses Roku and I just wanted something that could turn the TV off and on and control the volume. I was absolutely shocked when I got this remote and it very easily connected to my tv as well as my Roku and controls everything. One remote for everything on our bedroom TV at an unbelievable price. AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: CatW

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with APPLE TV
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work with Apple. Although the product says it works with APPLE TV, it is not compatible. I called GE, and couldn't get help. Must remember never to buy another GE product. Then I found the support number of the actual company that made it. I spent 30 minutes on the phone with them and they finally said, it's just not compatible with APPLE TV. So why do you advertise that it does?
customer_reviews.author: Murray Resin

customer_reviews.title: Buttons failed in 10 months
customer_reviews.text: Many crucial buttons failed by 10 months. It was a progressive spread of button failure, such that initially we just had to press harder, then one would finally give out, then another and another. I gave it 2 stars because it was easy to set up and, at this relatively low price, it may be worth just getting the same remote over and over.
customer_reviews.author: P-Fam

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work (well) with Roku, and no sleep button
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to consolidate my TV remote and my Roku remote into a single remote. This didn't work. The main issue not being connectivity, this remote is indeed compadable with Roku's. HOWEVER this remote does not have a back button (well it does but doesn't work with the roku). Meaning if you watching a video and want to go back to the application's menu, you need to go back to the roku home screen, reopen the app and navigate back to where you were. DOES NOT WORK WELL. Also minor but the remote does not have a sleep button, although the TV does have this functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Lemaire

customer_reviews.title: ATT U-verse, can’t navigate menus
customer_reviews.text: I have AT&T U-verse. My remote provided by ATT was chewed on by my dog, disabling the entire remote. So I ordered this one. I can control the volume ok. I can display menus. HOWEVER, I cannot navigate the menus. For instance, when playing a recorded program, I can display the options for the program (Resume Play, Start Over, Keep Until, Erase & Series Info). When the menu first appears, Resume Play is selected. But I CANNOT navigate to any other functions (Start Over, Erase, etc). Seems useless to not be able to do these other things. And it’s not just that menu. All menus cannot be navigated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brain Dead Simple
customer_reviews.text: All pros, NO cons - I've had the remote for about 2 hours and will say GE has done their job perfectly. The remote controls my Visio TV, Roku box, Sony DVD player, and Bose sound bar without any problems - 1st set of codes worked for each device. My only complaint is that I needed TWO pairs of glasses to read the setup codes (print was way too small). Highly recommended, and will be buying another next week.
customer_reviews.author: cdveal

customer_reviews.title: Best inexpensive multi-device remote I have used
customer_reviews.text: This remote control works very well and can be a complete replacement of the original OEM remote. I have used several from different brands and none have worked as well as the GE remote. I use it with Sharp, Sony, Insignia, and Panasonic products of varying ages and capabilities. In fact the first one worked so well I bought additional ones and threw the other remotes away, including some that cost 3 to 7 times more, but were not as reliable or capable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Generally Great, but not for Element nor Sceptre TVs
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it a 4-plus rating if it worked with Element or Sceptre Tvs more consistently. Bought two others that work great with Sanyo TVs. Auto code search yielded the correct codes to power the TVs on and off, but didn't work with volume control, which is a basic function. Element TV codes listed in code manual, but nothing for Sceptre. Hopefully helpful info until the next version rolls out. 2019-04-20
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Decent replacement
customer_reviews.text: Bought this remote to replace a Samsung Smart TV remote that my dog decided tasted good. Almost all of the basic functionality works like it should. The only thing I can really nitpick is that while in apps (such as netflix) the back button on the remote exits completely out of the app instead of just going back a screen. Other than that, I have no complaints. The setup was very easy and it just worked out of the package. If you're looking for a basic remote replacement, this is a good option.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Danger

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: This remote could not have been easier to install and begin using. My tv brand is near the end of the alphabet, so I used the first suggested number when I started the process, and it immediately started the tv. The controls are similar to the original that came with my tv, so using it is simple, too. The price was also very reasonable . I would highly recommend this remote.
customer_reviews.author: mysterylover

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this one. Instructions tell you to push various buttons and then count a flashing light to obtain a code. The light flashes really really Fast. Even so I think I got the code. What do you do with this code I hear you ask? If anyone finds out let me know - it certainly doesn’t say in the instructions. After 30 frustrating minutes this was back in the envelope with “does not work” written as the return reason
customer_reviews.author: B6

customer_reviews.title: works with many devices, but not everything
customer_reviews.text: It does have a ton of codes, for a variety of different devices. I was hoping to get it to work with an older (probably 10 years old now give or take) Toshiba blu-ray player. The player still works, but the remote for it died. Unfortunately, this does not work with that, so I connected it to a Roku, and it works great with that (and the TV the Roku is connected to). It is fine for an inexpensive remote, without a ton of bells and whistles. Especially with newer devices. Just be aware it may not be able to pair with all older devices.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.Top Contributor: Star Wars

product_meta.title: GE Universal Remote Control for Samsung, Vizio, LG, Sony, Sharp, Roku, Apple TV, RCA, Panasonic, Smart TVs, Streaming Players, Blu-ray, DVD, 4-Device, Black, 34457
product_meta.description:
Color:Brushed Black| Style:4-Device

Do you have a remote for every device in your home entertainment system? Simplify your life with the GE 4-Device Universal Remote Control. It can control up to 4 different a/v devices such as your TV, Blu-ray player, DVD, DVR, cable, satellite, audio, sound bars and streaming media players like Roku and Apple TV. The remote features a master volume control feature allowing you to control the volume no matter what device you're operating. The menu navigation buttons help you navigate the menu on DVRs and set top boxes, and the Dot button gives easy access to the sub-channels such as 4.2. The sleek brushed designer finish compliments any decor. The instruction manual and code library list is included, along with a video link for an easy-to-follow online setup video. The remote requires 2 AAA batteries, which are not included.

Please review our Code List under the Technical Specification section labeled as "Application Guide" to see if your device is compatible.
